p: Chloroquine/hydroxychloroquine was used as an antimalarial, broad spectrum antiviral drug, and has been broadly used in autoimmune diseases including lupus and rheumatoid arthritisÂ [ 76]. A recent study indicates that chloroquine and the antiviral drug RDV-inhibited SARS-CoV-2 in vitro [ 77]. Clinical symptoms of patients treated with chloroquine were obviously relieved: for example, more rapid decline in fever and improvement of lung CT [ 77]. Chloroquine was suggested to treat COVID-19 in the SARS-CoV-2 treatment guidelines by the Chinese medical advisory. Chloroquine has been highly effective in reducing SARS-CoV-2 viral replication by increasing endosomal pH and interfering with the glycosylation of cellular receptors [ 76]. Moreover, chloroquine was probably the first molecule to be used to treat COVID-19.
